name: throne

C2 the special chair used by a ruler, especially a king or queen
RonTech2000/ iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages the throne
C2 the state of being a ruler: Elizabeth II ascended/came to the throne (= became queen of Britain) when her father died. Queen Victoria was on the throne (= was queen) at that time. William is next in line to the throne (= will become king next). the throne informal humorous
the toilet: I can remember dad grabbing the newspaper and saying he'd be on the throne a while.
More examplesFewer examplesThe throne was carved from oak.His subjects knelt before the throne.Queen Elizabeth II ascended the throne in 1952.The young king's uncle usurped the throne.The survey found men were significantly more likely than women to use their phones and tablets to surf the web while on the throne.
